text: Ari Pakarinen (born 14 May 1969) is a retired male javelin thrower from Finland. His personal best throw is 85.18 metres, achieved in July 1995 in Lapua. He finished fifth at the 1993 World Championships. He later qualified for the final at the 2002 European Championships, but finished last with no valid result. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |19th |76.14 m |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |5th |81.08 m |- |2002 |European Championships |Munich, Germany |-- |DNF |} ==Seasonal bests== *1986 - 56.04 *1987 - 64.04 *1988 - 71.46 *1989 - 79.39 *1990 - 80.76 *1991 - 82.52 *1992 - 84.00 *1993 - 83.08 *1994 - 83.38 *1995 - 85.18 *1996 - 77.64 *1997 - 77.80 *1998 - 76.70 *1999 - 77.97 *2000 - 78.71 *2001 - 81.27 *2002 - 83.03 *2003 - 76.80 *2004 - 79.27 ==References== * Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Finnish male javelin throwers Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Finland
